page.title: 15The castle & church, Lidgate
page.content: The site on which the church stands today was, in 55BC an earthwork . Subsequently a flint castle was built, some of the remains of which are still visible today. Some cannon balls have been found nearby which suggests that a battle had been fought there. The present church dates from the 13th century and contains some fine woodwork and a brass purporting to be that of John de Lydgate a poet. The rector, resident in the village, is also rector of Cowlinge and Ousden. Every year a flower festival is held in the church and funds are raised to help in the upkeep of the building. These are executed by people from the Lidgate and surrounding villages. A choir has been formed by some of the villagers to lead the singing in the weekly service. The members of the congregation help maintain the church.
